Quick Facts

EXIT   X

COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT MEASURES

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

The regulator may issue a notice if it has reasonable grounds to believe that a person or corporation can give information, documents or evidence about a suspected breach. This notice will require the person to:

 

•

give the regulator information in writing that the person knows about

•

produce documents to the regulator

•

appear before the regulator and give evidence (either in writing or orally)

 

This can also be required if it would assist the regulator in monitoring or enforcing compliance with the Act.
